model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: The garlic chicken sounds delicious. Can you make it? What kinds of spicy foods have you taught yourself to make?
Speaker B: Yes, it's one of my favorites! It always remind me of the good old days. Spicy foods are great for the kick they have...like spicy fried rice! You should come over and try it.
Speaker A: I would love to, I enjoy cooking so maybe you can teach me to make it, too?
Speaker B: Yeah definitely! I know you like hot foods, so if you learn and can make them fresh it will taste amazing. Have you tried any new foods lately?
Speaker A: Not any new foods, but I did try a new food truck near me that was delicious! It was street tacos and you could pick from barbacoa, chicken, and steak for the protein. Do you like Mexican food? 
Speaker B: Oh god I do love Mexican food. That was be so hard to pick because they're all so good! Did they have al pastor by any chance? I loved marinated pork tacos.
Speaker A: unfortunately no, but I can ask them if they plan to get it in the future. I had one of each and they were all good in their own way. Have you ever had Birra tacos? I'd love to try those next.

[MEMORY]
- Speaker B enjoys cooking for loved ones and values their grandmother's garlic chicken recipe. This reminds them of the good old days.
- Speaker A wakes up early in the morning to catch waves, while Speaker B likes to eat huge steaks after snowboarding. They both have different routines but share a love for specific activities.
- Speaker B's grandmother was the matriarch of the family, known for cooking large meals for family gatherings. This is why Speaker B enjoys cooking for loved ones.
- Speaker A is part of a music band and plays the drums, and also loves making food for others.
